full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 198 of 228 874 LC2VMAX6 Alessi - Direct the books that you saw in Palm Beach that came from New York, the type was much larger; correct? A. Yes, sir. Q. And so that's different in what you're looking at in Exhibit 52; correct? A. Yes. Q. And as you sit here today, you can't tell us, for example, whether someone took a book from Mr. Epstein's house, took it to Kinko's, had it printed much smaller and shrunk down, took out pages, added pages, did whatever they did to it, and then rebound it. You can't -- you don't know whether that happened or not; correct? A. Correct. Q. You were not charged with -- you were not tasked or directed by anyone to maintain these books in Palm Beach? Do you understand my question, which may be a little complicated. It wasn't your job to take the books, put them in a folder, and put them in a drawer somewhere and keep them to record them for history, right? A. Not that I remember. Q. Okay. In fact, every time there was a new book that came out, the old books were destroyed, as I understand it; is that right? A. It was tossed in the garbage, yes. Q. Okay. Tossed in the garbage. And so there was no SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018071
